posts.message:
Hello Everybody, I need some help from an Expert Ubuntu Web Server administrator to help me optimize my DigitalOcean droplet performance any recommendations?

Droplet specs:
2 Core processor
2 GB memory 
40 GB SSD

## Server Environment ##

Server Info:              Apache/2.4.20 (Ubuntu)
Default Timezone:         UTC
MySQL Version:            5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1

Running 2 WordPress websites

-- PHP Configuration
PHP Version:              7.0.9-1+deb.sury.org~trusty+1
PHP Post Max Size:        32M
PHP Time Limit:           30
PHP Max Input Vars:       1000
PHP Safe Mode:            No
PHP Memory Limit:         128M
PHP Upload Max Size:      24M
PHP Upload Max Filesize:  24M
PHP Allow URL File Open:  Yes

Thanks

المشكلة عندى انى عامل Tabhost + ViewPager + Sliding menu فى Main Activity ال Sliding menu عملها فى شكل List وكل row فية صور وجمبة title (اول Load على ال Main thread )و كل fragment  بتتكون من Recycler view (تانى Load على ال Main thread ) فلم بدخل تاب تانية ال app مش بيكراش بس بيضلم =D اللى هو ال Main thread مش قادر يتحمل كل ال IO processing اللى بتم من خلال FirebaseUi وكمان الصور اللى بيتعملها Render جواها هتقولى اعمل Multi threading هقولك ازاى وهو لازم كل حاجة تستخدم  Main thread ui 
وكمان ال Firebase ui بتستخدم ال AsynchTask فى شغلها وبردة جربت احط شغل ال firebase ui جوة Thread وجوة ال thread دة حطيت جزء ال UI اللى بيتمثل فى ال ViewHolder جو getActivity().runOnUiThread وبردة المشكلة موجود ؟؟
المشكلة ان العميل عاوز جزء انيميشن كمان فى ال Recycle view دى =D
Submit four pull requests to win a free T-shirt :)

posts.description: Hacktoberfest is a month-long celebration of open source software.

posts.message:
Hello, Any one here has experience with open source Identity and Access Management software?

What I need is to authenticate users and authorize their access to certain objects. Apache Syncope provides a part of these functionalities but it doesn't provide direct authentication and authorization and needs an access manager to perform that functionality. Articles and forums recommended CAS, but apparently it needs a custom connector to integrate with Syncope which I don't want to.
